text: Albert Szent-Györgyi (Albert Szent-Györgyi de Nagyrápolt, 16 September 1893 22 October 1986) was an Hungarian scientist. He won the 1937 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his discoveries about Vitamin C. He was commonly known for discovering a vitamin that our bodies cannot make, vitamin C ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Hungarian scientists Category:Pharmacologists Category:Hungarian Nobel Prize winners
title: Albert Szent-Györgyi
